Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome
[H1] POLYCYSTIC OVARIAN SYNDROME.
[H2] Presence of oligo- or anovulation in combination with hyperandrogenism.
[LIST_ITEM] Chronic anovulation may present as irregular menstrual periods or amenorrhea.
[LIST_ITEM] It is not essential to document anovulation by ultrasonography or progesterone measurements in the presence of a clear clinical history
[LIST_ITEM] PCOS occurs in 85 to 90% of women with oligomenorrhea and in 30-40% of women with amenorrhea
[LIST_ITEM] Diagnosed either by clinical (hirsutism) or laboratory (elevated testosterone or androstenedione)
[LIST_ITEM] Should not be diagnosed if evidence of other causes of oligo-ovulation and hyperandrogenism (ovarian androgen secreting tumor or nonclassical adrenal hyperplasia)
[LIST_ITEM] Prevalence of PCOS is approximately 5–7% of women of reproductive age
[LIST_ITEM] 50% of PCOS women are obese and tend to have an android pattern of obesity
[H2] Elevated levels of serum LH - increased LH pulse amplitude and LH pulse frequency.
[LIST_ITEM] Steady-state levels of gonadotropins and ovarian steroids
[LIST_ITEM] “chronic estrous state”
[LIST_ITEM] Proliferation and hyperplasia of the endometrium
[LIST_ITEM] Can lead to unpredictable bleeding episodes
[LIST_ITEM] Unopposed estrogen exposure -confirmed by progesterone withdrawal test
[LIST_ITEM] Women with PCOS have higher mean concentrations of LH
[LIST_ITEM] Increased bioactivity of LH
[LIST_ITEM] Low to low-normal levels of follicle stimulating hormone
[LIST_ITEM] Obese PCOS women do not have elevated LH levels
[LIST_ITEM] ☐ normal LH level or normal LH/FSH ratio does not rule out PCOS
[LIST_ITEM] ☐ LH/FSH ratio is now not included in the diagnostic criteria of PCOS
[LIST_ITEM] In research studies almost all women with PCOS have elevated LH secretion.
[LIST_ITEM] In clinical practice - difficult to use a single measurement of LH to diagnose PCOS,
[LIST_ITEM] LH is secreted in a pulsatile manner
[LIST_ITEM] Normal range of serum LH concentration decreases with increasing body mass index (BMI)
